meanings.definition: In a shamelessly wicked or immoral manner.
meanings.sent1: She flagitiously lied about her whereabouts.
meanings.sent2: He flagitiously cheated on the test without any remorse.
meanings.sent3: The cat flagitiously knocked over the vase and then pretended to be innocent.
meanings.sent4: The politician flagitiously accepted bribes behind closed doors.
meanings.sent5: The thief flagitiously stole the jewels under the cover of darkness.

meanings.sent1: The flagitiously greedy businessman exploited his workers for profit.
meanings.sent2: Her flagitiously lavish lifestyle was funded by ill-gotten gains.
meanings.sent3: The flagitiously extravagant party had guests talking for weeks.
meanings.sent4: The flagitiously corrupt official was finally exposed by the media.
meanings.sent5: The flagitiously deceptive scheme unraveled when the truth came to light.
